class pyxalign.io.save.Number[source]

Bases: object

All numbers inherit from this class.

If you just want to check if an argument x is a number, without caring what kind, use isinstance(x, Number).

pyxalign.io.save.convert_to_uint_16(images: ndarray, min: float = None, max: float = None)[source]
pyxalign.io.save.draw_text_with_default_font(base_image: Image, text: str, x: int, y: int, scale_factor: float = 2.0) → None[source]

Draw text at position (x, y) using Pillow’s default bitmap font, scaled up by ‘scale_factor’. The drawing is done in place on base_image.

Parameters:

  • base_image – Pillow Image in mode “I” (32-bit integer) or similar.

  • text – The text string to draw.

  • x – Left coordinate on the base image where text will be placed.

  • y – Top coordinate on the base image where text will be placed.

  • scale_factor – How much to scale up the default font’s size.

pyxalign.io.save.save_array_as_tiff(images: ndarray, file_path: str, min_val: float = None, max_val: float = None, divide_into_smaller_files: bool = True, numbers: ndarray = None, text_scale: float = 2.0)[source]

Save a 3D NumPy array (images) to a TIFF file. Optionally, pass a 1D array (numbers) of the same length as images.shape[0], each of which is drawn in the top-left corner of each slice at a scaled-up size (using the built-in PIL font).

Parameters:

  • images – 3D data array of shape (N, H, W).

  • file_path – Path of the output tif file.

  • min_val – Minimum value for scaling into uint16.

  • max_val – Maximum value for scaling into uint16.

  • divide_into_smaller_files – Whether to split the output into multiple smaller files if the total size exceeds ~4 GB.

  • numbers – 1D array of length N, containing numeric values to overlay on each slice.

  • text_scale – Factor by which to scale the default font size (>= 1.0).

pyxalign.io.save.save_generic_data_structure_to_h5(d: dict, h5_obj: Group | File)[source]

Create h5 datasets for all items in the passed in dict
